description: Proposed by Sungyong Chung, Yanlin Zhang, Nachuan Li, Dana Monzer, and Alireza Talebpour, this model introduces a new paradigm of data-driven car-following. It models driving as a Markov process, predicting behavior by randomly sampling accelerations from empirical distributions within discretized state bins.
assumptions: Markovian assumption: Future acceleration depends only on the current state cluster defined by relative speed, spacing, and follower speed.
calibration: Calibration-free. It empirically derives state transitions and acceleration distributions directly from the OpenCF Training Set.
